           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      yuanv...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/451807895" title="yuanv...@gmail.com"><!---->yuanv...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      yuanv...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->yuanv...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sun, Jun 6, 2021, 2:30 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 6, 2021, 2:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] class="undefined" target="_blank"         <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;TabStrip
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>

That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in         You're right, I meant <span class="line"><!---->You're right, I meant <!----></span>issue 1207315<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1207315" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in extensions"><!---->issue 1207315<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>That other bug suggests this may be reproducible back to M92, so adjusting FoundIn. That will prompt us to merge this to M92, but we're about to cut the stable RC, so let's not merge just yet - let's wait till the first stable refresh.<span class="line"><!---->That other bug suggests this may be reproducible back to M92, so adjusting FoundIn.         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }

          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Cancel
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=863;drc=cf4eb44b36901a7b1d7b234d91febe442f0500d4;bpv=1;bpt=0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=863;drc=cf4eb44b36901a7b1d7b234d91febe442f0500d4;bpv=1;bpt=0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=863;drc=cf4eb44b36901a7b1d7b234d91febe442f0500d4;bpv=1;bpt=0<!----></a><br><br>Add ContainsIndex(index) check in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked will fix this.<span class="line"><!---->Add ContainsIndex(index) check in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked will fix this.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-889087, 93.0.4532.0, stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-889087, 93.0.4532.0, stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>I found this crash in my fuzz system and maybe it was trigged by some unstable parallel operations.<span class="line"><!---->I found this crash in my fuzz system and maybe it was trigged by some unstable parallel operations.<!----></span><br>I am still try to reproduce it and will submit poc files if success.<span class="line"><!---->I am still try to reproduce it and will submit poc files if success.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd"><!---->8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<!----></a><br>Author: David Pennington <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Pennington &lt;<!----></span>dpenning@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dpenning@chromium.org"><!---->dpenning@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Sep 08 18:16:38 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Sep 08 18:16:38 2021<!----></span><br><br>[M90-LTS] Fix calling TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked with kNoTab<span class="line"><!---->[M90-LTS] Fix calling TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked with kNoTab<!----></span><br><br>A fuzzer found a potential heap buffer overflow caused by the<span class="line"><!---->A fuzzer found a potential heap buffer overflow caused by the<!----></span><br>BrowserCommandController not checking that there is an active index in<span class="line"><!---->BrowserCommandController not checking that there is an active index in<!----></span><br>the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

        Create new hotlist<h3 class="medium-heading">Create new hotlist</h3>
        
          New hotlist name:<label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      yuanv...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/451807895" title="yuanv...@gmail.com"><!---->yuanv...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      yuanv...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->yuanv...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sun, Jun 6, 2021, 2:30 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 6, 2021, 2:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 6, 2021, 2:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          </h1>

          </small>

      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 6, 2021, 2:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br>[2] ContainsIndex(index) check in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked will fix this.<span class="line"><!---->Add ContainsIndex(index) check in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked will fix That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank"             Issue 1216898: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in         You're right, I meant <span class="line"><!---->You're right, I meant <!----></span>issue 1207315<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1207315" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in extensions"><!---->issue 1207315<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>That other bug suggests this may be reproducible back to M92, so adjusting FoundIn.         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank"       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_command_controller.cc;l=1537?q=browser_command_controller.cc&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=863;drc=cf4eb44b36901a7b1d7b234d91febe442f0500d4;bpv=1;bpt=0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=863;drc=cf4eb44b36901a7b1d7b234d91febe442f0500d4;bpv=1;bpt=0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=863;drc=cf4eb44b36901a7b1d7b234d91febe442f0500d4;bpv=1;bpt=0<!----></a><br><br>Add ContainsIndex(index) check in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked will fix this.<span class="line"><!---->Add ContainsIndex(index) check in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked will fix this.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-889087, 93.0.4532.0, stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-889087, 93.0.4532.0, stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>I found this crash in my fuzz system and maybe it was trigged by some unstable parallel operations.<span class="line"><!---->I found this crash in my fuzz system and maybe it was trigged by some unstable parallel operations.<!----></span><br>I am still try to reproduce it and will submit poc files if success.<span class="line"><!---->I am still try to reproduce it and will submit poc files if success.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==392==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x11b169a9bd98 at pc 0x7ffad069eb99 bp 0x0078c7dfd570 sp 0x0078c7dfd5b8<span class="line"><!---->==392==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x11b169a9bd98 at pc 0x7ffad069eb99 bp 0x0078c7dfd570 sp 0x0078c7dfd5b8<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x11b169a9bd98 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x11b169a9bd98 thread T0<!----></span><br>==392==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<span class="line"><!---->==392==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7ffad069eb98 in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\chrome\browser\ui\tabs\tab_strip_model.cc:864<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x7ffad069eb98 in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\chrome\browser\ui\tabs\tab_strip_model.cc:864<!----></span><br>    #1 0x7ffad4650b7f in chrome::BrowserCommandController::UpdateCommandsForFind         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa"><!---->5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<!----></a><br>Author: David Pennington <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Pennington &lt;<!----></span>dpenning@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dpenning@chromium.org"><!---->dpenning@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jul 10 19:41:29 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jul 10 19:41:29 2021<!----></span><br><br>Fix calling TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked with kNoTab<span class="line"><!---->Fix calling TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked with kNoTab<!----></span><br><br>A fuzzer found a potential heap buffer overflow caused by the<span class="line"><!---->A fuzzer found a potential heap buffer overflow caused by the<!----></span><br>BrowserCommandController not checking that there is an active index in<span class="line"><!---->BrowserCommandController not checking that there is an active index in<!----></span><br>the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues<!----></a> Impact guidelines: <span class="line"><!----> Impact guidelines: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security<!----></a> Thanks for your time! <span class="line"><!----> Thanks for your time! <!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug.         updating as reward-ineligible as <span class="line"><!---->updating as reward-ineligible as <!----></span>issue 1207315<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1207315" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in extensions"><!---->issue 1207315<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>was reported prior to this issue<span class="line"><!---->was reported prior to this issue<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<span class="line"><!---->I found the crash in my fuzz system. The problem is very clear.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. ASAN report it as heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->chrome.desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia call in extension trigger IsTabBlocked check for active tab, but TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked[2] does not check index in, sometimes the index get by active_index[1] is -1. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd"><!---->8fa238ddef36b966c3bb74cbc4eb45dbb82c45cd<!----></a><br>Author: David Pennington <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Pennington &lt;<!----></span>dpenning@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dpenning@chromium.org"><!---->dpenning@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Sep 08 18:16:38 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Sep 08 18:16:38 2021<!----></span><br><br>[M90-LTS] Fix calling TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked with kNoTab<span class="line"><!---->[M90-LTS] Fix calling TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked with kNoTab<!----></span><br><br>A fuzzer found a potential heap buffer overflow caused by the<span class="line"><!---->A fuzzer found a potential heap buffer overflow caused by the<!----></span><br>BrowserCommandController not checking that there is an active index in<span class="line"><!---->BrowserCommandController not checking that there is an active index in<!----></span><br>the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<span class="line"><!---->the tab strip model before making changes. That callsite is fixed by<!----></span><br>adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<span class="line"><!---->adding a check before using the active_index and a DCHECK is added<!----></span><br>to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<span class="line"><!---->to the function for IsTabBlocked that will trigger when using kNoTab.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa"><!---->5c38a303b8c9e8b2c23705214026dd3cba52d3fa<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1216898<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1216898" title="Security: heap-buffer-overflow in TabStripModel::IsTabBlocked"><!---->Bug: 1216898<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I17b49c4cd1c24a78d6bd044f27692c8320725c0f<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I17b49c4cd1c24a78d6bd044f27692c8320725c0f<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
